task.title: Add a table
task.shortdesc: Tables are excellent way to organize and display complex information.

step.cmd: In your topic, place your cursor on a new, empty line.
From the toolbar, select Insert Table.
Specify the number of rows and columns.

choices.choice: whether the table will beÂ the full width of the page
where on the page it will be aligned
where a frame will be displayed
whether column and row separators will be displayed

step.cmd: (Optional) Right click anywhere in the table and select Choose table element.
step.info:
This will allow you to specify which type of table you want to create. Choose from
general CALs table
choice table
simple table
Which of these is available will depend upon the topic type you are working in. The default will be a simple table.

step.cmd: (Optional) Right click anywhere in the table and select Table Options.
step.info: From here you can modify the display settings for your table.

step.cmd: (Optional) Right click anywhere on the table and select Row or Column to set a heading row or column

taskbody.result: The table is inserted, with all header cells in blue.
